text: In a forgotten library, you discover a book wrapped in black cloth. It whispers your name.
You unwrap it. The title reads: 'The Cursed City Palace of Jaipur'. Pages are blank—then they turn on their own
A voice whispers: 'You wanted to the cursed palace. I'll take you there
You land at Mubarak Mahal under a moonlit sky. The palace is silent. You feel eyes watching.

options.text: Walk into the shadows behind you

text: You walk toward the Crafts Demonstration Area. Tools clang… but no one’s there. You hear whispers in Marwari.

options.text: Step back slowly and cross to Sileh Khana

text: You reach Sileh Khana. Weapons float and clash mid-air. Ghostly officers duel. One turns and stares at you.

options.text: Try to speak to the officer

text: You enter Diwan-i-Aam. The throne is empty, but footsteps surround you.

options.text: Crawl behind the pillar and hide
Kneel and pretend to be a servant

text: The ghost of an English officer laughs from the throne. "The Maharaja never left," he snarls.
You’re near Rajendra Pol. The gates bleed. Two Silver Urns glimmer beside.

Inside the urn, you find a lighter. You flick it on. An inscription reads:
‘Above the moon, beyond the fire — the mantra lies on Chandra’s spire.’
‘Speak it to awaken the sleeping gods.’

options.text: Commit the mantra clue to memory

text: The palace shakes slightly. A chant echoes from afar.
You step out and find a cracked idol of Ganesh near the gate.

options.text: Try to pry off the gem in its forehead

text: You reach Ridhi Sidhi Pol. The arch pulses with strange red light.
You reach Pritam Chowk — four season-painted doors. All slam shut, then one creaks open.
Inside is a mirror room. Your reflection doesn’t match you.
You fall through a hidden chute into a chamber of whispers.

options.text: Chant 'Om Namah Shivaya' to calm them

text: The whispers vanish. A dead Marwari worker appears, holding out a key.
You use the key on a locked room. Inside: a floating conch.
A stairway appears leading up, carved into the wall.

options.text: Light your way with the lighter

text: The walls are painted with war scenes. The eyes of painted soldiers move.
You reach a small shrine with a half-burned diya.
You ascend Chandra Mahal. The halls twist unnaturally.
A royal woman glides past, humming a lullaby. She’s headless.
A wall ahead is covered in Sanskrit — part of the mantra.
The wind picks up violently. A voice says, 'Only the pure heart may pass.'

options.text: Bow down and ask to be forgiven

text: A door blocks the rooftop. It requires a sacrifice.

options.text: Offer a drop of your blood

text: You step onto the rooftop. The full moon shines. The final mantra is inscribed on a stone.
The spirits scream. The ground shakes. Light bursts from the sky.
You rise into the sky. The vortex returns. Faces of the cursed reach for you.

options.text: Fold hands and offer them peace

text: You wake up in the library. The book is closed beside you. One drop of blood stains the page. You survived.
